newsitem.title: GHANA: Ghana stock exchange rises on bank sector interest.
newsitem.headline: Ghana stock exchange rises on bank sector interest.

text.p: The Ghana Stock Exchange index rose on Monday, fuelled by Aluworks and interest in the banking sector, its market report showed.
Aluworks rose 30 cedis to 1,210 cedis, whilst Ghana Commercial Bank (+10 cedis to 625 cedis) continued its upward trend. The bank's shares stood at 580 cedis on April 11.
The three other risers were Social Security Bank (+5 to 1,285), Unilever (+4 to 855) and Mechanical Lloyd (+2 to 75).
The Ghana All-Share index rose by 1.84 points to 372.89 from 371.05 on Friday.
Trade was moderate with 32,990 shares changing hands, included 25,400 transactions on Ghana Commercial Bank, 2,500 on Mechanical Lloyd and 2,300 on Aluworks.
